input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
Specifies the domain controller to perform the import or export operation.
Sets the distinguished name of the search base for data export.

Sets the search scope.
Valid values are: Base, OneLevel, SubTree
Sets the command to run using the supplied UserDistinguishedName.
Sets the command to run using the supplied UserDistinguishedName Password
Sets the command to run using a domain user name.
Sets the command to run the supplied domain username password.
The ldap value to filter upon. An example would be: sn=User

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" cdata-section-elements="command " /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ldifde</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${domain}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -s ${domain}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${base dn}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -d $[base dn]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${scope}') != 0 and '${scope}' = 'Base'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -p ${scope}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${scope}') != 0 and '${scope}' = 'OneLevel'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -p ${scope}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${scope}') != 0 and '${scope}' = 'SubTree'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -p ${scope}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[ldap filter object class]') != 0 and string-length('$[ldap filter value]')!= 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -r (&(objectClass=$[ldap filter object class])($[ldap filter value]))</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[user dn]') != 0 and string-length('$[user dn password]')!= 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -a $[user dn] $[user dn password]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[domain user name]') != 0 and string-length('$[domain password]')!= 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -b $[domain user name] $[domain password]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform Active Directory Query Queries Active Directory user and group information.
